Class DatabaseCollectionReader

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LeoCollectionReaderInterface, org.apache.uima.collection.base_cpm.BaseCollectionReader, org.apache.uima.collection.CollectionReader, org.apache.uima.resource.ConfigurableResource, org.apache.uima.resource.Resource
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BatchDatabaseCollectionReader

    public class DatabaseCollectionReader
extends BaseDatabaseCollectionReader
    CollectionReader that executes a SQL query one time to pull the needed data from the database. Assumes one record per row of the ResultSet. User: Thomas Ginter Date: 7/11/14 Time: 17:08

      • DatabaseCollectionReader

        public DatabaseCollectionReader()
        Default constructor used during UIMA initialization.

      • DatabaseCollectionReader

        public DatabaseCollectionReader(DatabaseConnectionInformation databaseConnectionInformation,
                        DataQueryInformation dataQueryInformation)
        Initialize with the database connection and query information.
        Parameters:
        databaseConnectionInformation - database connection information to use.
        dataQueryInformation - database query for retrieving results, assumes one record per row.

      • DatabaseCollectionReader

        public DatabaseCollectionReader(DatabaseConnectionInformation databaseConnectionInformation,
                        String query,
                        String idColumn,
                        String noteColumn)
        Initialize with the database connection and query information.
        Parameters:
        databaseConnectionInformation - database connection information to use.
        query - SQL query used to retrieve the data, one record per row of results.
        idColumn - name of the ID column in the SQL query. Assumes only one column to use as the record ID. Additional ID fields are propagated through the row results String array of the CSI annotation.
        noteColumn - name of the note column in the SQL query. Assumes only one note column.

      • DatabaseCollectionReader

        public DatabaseCollectionReader(String driver,
                        String url,
                        String username,
                        String password,
                        String query,
                        String idColumn,
                        String noteColumn)
        Initialize with the database connection and query information.
        Parameters:
        driver - JDBC driver class
        url - JDBC connection URL
        username - database user name.
        password - database user password.
        query - SQL query used to retrieve the data, one record per row of results.
        idColumn - name of the ID column in the SQL query. Assumes only one column to use as the record ID. Additional ID fields are propagated through the row results String array of the CSI annotation.
        noteColumn - name of the note column in the SQL query. Assumes only one note column.

    • Method Detail

      • validateParams

        protected void validateParams(String query,
                  String idColumn,
                  String noteColumn)
        Validate the parameters for the DatabaseCollectionReader to ensure that none of the required arguments are missing or invalid.
        Parameters:
        query - SQL query to execute to retrieve the data.
        idColumn - Name of the column from which the record ID will be maintained.
        noteColumn - Name of the column which contains the note.

      • getProgress

        public org.apache.uima.util.Progress[] getProgress()
        Gets information about the number of entities and/or amount of data that has been read from this CollectionReader, and the total amount that remains (if that information is available).

        This method returns an array of Progress objects so that results can be reported using different units. For example, the CollectionReader could report progress in terms of the number of documents that have been read and also in terms of the number of bytes that have been read. In many cases, it will be sufficient to return just one Progress object.

        Specified by:
        getProgress in interface org.apache.uima.collection.base_cpm.BaseCollectionReader
        Specified by:
        getProgress in class BaseDatabaseCollectionReader
        Returns:
        an array of Progress objects. Each object may have different units (for example number of entities or bytes).
